page.title: 17 CUDHAM - BLACKSMITH'S ARMS
page.content: {The Blacksmith's Arms Public House} is situated in the centre of Cudham between the Church and the village Post Office with the Recreation Ground behind. It is about 300 years old and has been a pub for at least 100 years. The original building has been extended and there is now only one bar instead of three. The pub provides food with meals served at lunchtimes and evenings (except Sundays). There is a large car park and garden complete with barbecue and tables. Inside is a games room with arcade game machines and a dart board. Drinking habits have changed in recent years with drinking becoming more of a social event. The pub is therefore a major social meeting place and focal point of village life. Although tastes change with cider,wine and spirits more popular, draught bitter is still the best seller.
